intro: Senecio timidus, commonly known as the shy senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, and it has narrow, silvery-green leaves. Senecio timidus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
